page.title: 02General Review
page.content: this area include cereals,i.e.wheat, barley, oil-seed rape and vegetables i.e. potatoes, broad beans, and peas. The peas are grown on contract for freezer processing firms in Grimsby 54km.away on the East coast. The drainage system is now used to drain excess water from the land and to provide water during the summer months for irrigation and fertiliser spraying.The drains are managed by Crowle Internal Drainage Board.The smaller field drains are maintained by the farmers themselves and can be infilled if so desired without contact with the Board. The drains were once full of wildlife but now only a few solitary Mayflowers grow against the bank and a few ducks nest on the quieter banks.This is due to the increasing use of artificial fertilisers.
